title: Quick Start
text: using gluedocking, need configure environment specifying paths required external tools: Alternatively, can use file4gluedocking package get paths: store paths R environment file, need run .
code: library(gluedocking) prepare_for_gluedocking(   python_path = "/your_path/python.exe",   prepare_receptor_script = "/your_path/prepare_receptor4.py",   prepare_ligand_script = "/your_path/prepare_ligand4.py",   obabel_path = "/your_path/obabel.exe",   vina_path = "/your_path/qvinaw.exe" ) # Install file4gluedocking from GitHub devtools::install_github("RightSZ/file4gluedocking") library(file4gluedocking) prepare_for_gluedocking(   python_path = get_python_path(),   prepare_receptor_script = get_prepare_receptor_path(),   prepare_ligand_script = get_prepare_ligand_path(),   obabel_path = get_obabel_path(),   vina_path = get_qvinaw_path() )

title: Quick Start
code: # Download PDB files from RCSB PDB database pdb_files <- download_receptor(c("1iep", "4hg7"), out_dir = "receptors")

title: Quick Start
code: # Download ligand structures from PubChem ligand_files <- download_ligand(c("2244", "5090"), out_dir = "ligands")

title: Quick Start
code: # Convert PDB files to PDBQT format for docking receptor_pdbqt <- prepare_receptor(   pdb_files,   out_dir = "prepared_receptors" )

title: Quick Start
code: # Convert SDF to MOL2 converted_files<-convert_molecule(   input_file = "receptors",   output_format = "mol2" )  # Convert ligand files to PDBQT format for docking ligand_pdbqt <- prepare_ligand(   converted_files,   out_dir = "prepared_ligands" )

title: Quick Start
code: # Determine appropriate docking box dimensions and center coordinates box_params <- calculate_box(pdb_files, padding = 5)

title: Quick Start
code: # Create configuration files for docking config_files <- write_configs(   receptor_paths = receptor_pdbqt,   ligand_paths = ligand_pdbqt,   box_df = box_params,   out_dir = "configs" )

title: Quick Start
code: # Run molecular docking using AutoDock Vina run_vina(   config_paths = "configs",   out = "docked",   logs = "logs" )

what: 8. Check and Rerun Failed Docking Jobs
title: Quick Start
code: # Check log files and rerun any failed docking jobs check_logs(   logs = "logs",   out = "docked",   config_paths = "configs" )

title: Quick Start
code: # Parse all log files and combine results results <- parse_logs(log_folder = "logs")  # View top binding poses head(results[order(results$affinity_kcalmol), ])

title: Quick Start
text: can also run docking directly without configuration files:
code: run_vina(   receptor = "receptor.pdbqt",   ligand = "ligand.pdbqt",   center = c(0, 0, 0),   size = c(20, 20, 20),   exhaustiveness = 8 )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Beihao Li. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Li B (2025). gluedocking: Molecular Docking Automation Tools Drug Discovery. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gluedocking: Molecular Docking Automation Tools for Drug Discovery},   author = {Beihao Li},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Molecular Docking Automation Tools for Drug Discovery
text: gluedocking R package designed streamline molecular docking workflows. provides comprehensive set functions downloading protein ligand structures, preparing docking files, running AutoDock Vina docking calculations, analyzing docking results. package wraps common molecular docking tools, enabling researchers efficiently perform virtual screening drug discovery studies within R environment.

title: Molecular Docking Automation Tools for Drug Discovery
text: Download protein structures RCSB PDB database Download ligand structures PubChem database Prepare receptor ligand files using AutoDock Tools Convert molecular file formats using OpenBabel Automatically calculate docking box parameters Generate AutoDock Vina configuration files Run molecular docking calculations Parse analyze docking results Find https://github.com/RightSZ/gluedocking

title: Molecular Docking Automation Tools for Drug Discovery
text: using gluedocking, need install several external tools: Python - Required running AutoDock Tools scripts MGLTools - Contains prepare_receptor4.py prepare_ligand4.py scripts OpenBabel - molecular file format conversion AutoDock Vina - molecular docking calculations can install development version gluedocking GitHub :
code: # Install the development version from GitHub if(!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("RightSZ/gluedocking")

title: Molecular Docking Automation Tools for Drug Discovery
text: package licensed MIT License. See LICENSE file details.

what: Calculate docking box parameters from PDB structures — calculate_box
title: Calculate docking box parameters from PDB structures — calculate_box
text: function analyzes PDB files determine appropriate docking box dimensions center coordinates based protein structure.

title: Calculate docking box parameters from PDB structures — calculate_box
code: calculate_box(pdb_files, padding = 5)

title: Calculate docking box parameters from PDB structures — calculate_box
text: pdb_files Character vector paths PDB files padding Numeric, additional padding add around protein Angstroms, default 5

title: Calculate docking box parameters from PDB structures — calculate_box
text: Data frame containing file names, center coordinates (x,y,z) box dimensions (x,y,z)

title: Calculate docking box parameters from PDB structures — calculate_box
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ box_params <- calculate_box(pdb_files, padding = 5) } # }

what: Check docking log files and rerun failed docking jobs — check_logs
title: Check docking log files and rerun failed docking jobs — check_logs
text: Check docking log files rerun failed docking jobs

title: Check docking log files and rerun failed docking jobs — check_logs
code: check_logs(   logs = "logs",   out = "docked",   config_paths = NULL,   vina_path = NULL,   seed = 12345,   cpu = NULL,   force = FALSE )

title: Check docking log files and rerun failed docking jobs — check_logs
text: logs Character, directory containing log files, default "logs" Character, output directory docked files, default "docked" config_paths Character vector paths config files directories containing config files vina_path Character, path vina executable, default "vina" seed Integer, random seed reproducibility, default 12345 cpu Integer, number CPU cores use parallel computation, default NULL (auto-detect) force Logical, whether force rerun jobs regardless log status, default FALSE

title: Check docking log files and rerun failed docking jobs — check_logs
text: Character vector rerun log files

title: Check docking log files and rerun failed docking jobs — check_logs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Check log files and rerun any failed docking jobs check_logs(   logs = "logs",   out = "docked",   config_paths = "configs" ) } # }

what: Convert molecule file formats using OpenBabel — convert_molecule
title: Convert molecule file formats using OpenBabel — convert_molecule
text: function converts molecular structure files different formats using OpenBabel chemical toolbox. supports converting single file, multiple files, files directory.

title: Convert molecule file formats using OpenBabel — convert_molecule
code: convert_molecule(   input_file,   input_format = NULL,   output_file = NULL,   output_format = NULL,   output_dir = "converted",   pattern = NULL,   recursive = FALSE,   obabel_path = NULL )

title: Convert molecule file formats using OpenBabel — convert_molecule
text: input_file Character, path input molecule file, character vector file paths, directory containing molecule files convert input_format Character, format input file, default NULL (auto-detect file extension) output_file Character, path output file, default NULL (auto-generate based input file name) output_format Character, format output file, default NULL (auto-detect output file extension) output_dir Character, directory save output files, default converted pattern Character, file pattern match input_file directory, default NULL (files) recursive Logical, whether search recursively directories, default FALSE obabel_path Character, path OpenBabel executable, default NULL (uses GLUEDOCK_OBABEL_PATH environment variable)

title: Convert molecule file formats using OpenBabel — convert_molecule
text: Character vector paths successfully converted files, NULL conversion failed

title: Convert molecule file formats using OpenBabel — convert_molecule
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Convert a single file convert_molecule("ligand.sdf", output_format = "mol2") } # }

what: Download ligand structures from PubChem — download_ligand
title: Download ligand structures from PubChem — download_ligand
text: function downloads chemical compound structures PubChem database using CIDs.

title: Download ligand structures from PubChem — download_ligand
code: download_ligand(cids, out_dir = "ligands", verify_ssl = TRUE)

title: Download ligand structures from PubChem — download_ligand
text: cids Character vector PubChem Compound IDs (CIDs) download out_dir Character, output directory downloaded files, default "ligands" verify_ssl Logical, whether verify SSL certificates, default TRUE

title: Download ligand structures from PubChem — download_ligand
text: List successfully downloaded file paths

title: Download ligand structures from PubChem — download_ligand
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ files <- download_ligand(c("2244", "5090"), out_dir = "compounds") } # }

code: download_receptor(pdb_ids, out_dir = "./", verify_ssl = TRUE)

text: pdb_ids Character vector PDB IDs download out_dir Character, output directory downloaded files, default "./" verify_ssl Logical, whether verify SSL certificates, default TRUE

title: Download PDB files from RCSB PDB database — download_receptor
text: List successfully downloaded file paths

title: Download PDB files from RCSB PDB database — download_receptor
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ files <- download_receptor(c("1iep", "4hg7"), out_dir = "receptors") } # }

what: Parse all log files in a directory and combine results — parse_logs
title: Parse all log files in a directory and combine results — parse_logs
text: Parse log files directory combine results

title: Parse all log files in a directory and combine results — parse_logs
code: parse_logs(log_folder = "logs", pattern = "\\.txt$", verbose = TRUE)

title: Parse all log files in a directory and combine results — parse_logs
text: log_folder Character, path directory containing log files, default "logs" pattern Character, pattern match log files, default "\.txt$" verbose Logical, whether print detailed messages, default TRUE

title: Parse all log files in a directory and combine results — parse_logs
text: data frame containing combined docking results log files

title: Parse all log files in a directory and combine results — parse_logs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Parse all log files and combine results results <- parse_logs(log_folder = "logs") } # }

what: Parse QVina docking log files — parse_qvina_log
title: Parse QVina docking log files — parse_qvina_log
text: function extracts docking results QVina log files, including binding affinities RMSD values docking pose.

title: Parse QVina docking log files — parse_qvina_log
code: parse_qvina_log(file_path)

title: Parse QVina docking log files — parse_qvina_log
text: file_path Character, path QVina log file

title: Parse QVina docking log files — parse_qvina_log
text: Data frame containing docking results columns mode, affinity (kcal/mol), RMSD values, NULL parsing fails

title: Parse QVina docking log files — parse_qvina_log
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ results <- parse_qvina_log("docking_results.txt") } # }

title: Configure environment for GlueDocking — prepare_for_gluedocking
text: function sets necessary environment variables GlueDocking checking storing paths required external tools R environment file.

title: Configure environment for GlueDocking — prepare_for_gluedocking
code: prepare_for_gluedocking(   python_path = NULL,   prepare_receptor_script = NULL,   prepare_ligand_script = NULL,   obabel_path = NULL,   vina_path = NULL,   force = FALSE )

title: Configure environment for GlueDocking — prepare_for_gluedocking
text: python_path Character, path Python executable prepare_receptor_script Character, path prepare_receptor4.py script prepare_ligand_script Character, path prepare_ligand4.py script obabel_path Character, path OpenBabel executable vina_path Character, path AutoDock Vina executable force Logical, whether overwrite existing environment variables, default FALSE

title: Configure environment for GlueDocking — prepare_for_gluedocking
text: Invisibly returns TRUE setup successful

title: Configure environment for GlueDocking — prepare_for_gluedocking
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ prepare_for_gluedocking(   python_path = "C:/Python39/python.exe",   prepare_receptor_script = "C:/MGLTools/scripts/prepare_receptor4.py",   prepare_ligand_script = "C:/MGLTools/scripts/prepare_ligand4.py",   obabel_path = "C:/OpenBabel/bin/obabel.exe",   vina_path = "C:/AutoDock_Vina/vina.exe" ) } # }

what: Prepare ligand files for molecular docking — prepare_ligand
title: Prepare ligand files for molecular docking — prepare_ligand
text: function processes molecule files prepare molecular docking converting PDBQT format using AutoDock Tools scripts.

title: Prepare ligand files for molecular docking — prepare_ligand
code: prepare_ligand(   mol_files,   out_dir = "./",   python_path = NULL,   prepare_script = NULL,   add_opts = "-A hydrogens" )

title: Prepare ligand files for molecular docking — prepare_ligand
text: mol_files Character vector paths molecule files (SDF, MOL, etc.) out_dir Character, output directory prepared files, default "./" python_path Character, path Python executable, default "python" prepare_script Character, path prepare_ligand4.py script add_opts Character, additional options pass prepare_ligand4.py, default "-hydrogens"

title: Prepare ligand files for molecular docking — prepare_ligand
text: Character vector paths successfully prepared PDBQT files

title: Prepare ligand files for molecular docking — prepare_ligand
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ pdbqt_files <- prepare_ligand(sdf_files,                               out_dir = "prepared",                               prepare_script = "path/to/prepare_ligand4.py") } # }

what: Prepare receptor PDB files for molecular docking — prepare_receptor
title: Prepare receptor PDB files for molecular docking — prepare_receptor
text: function processes PDB files prepare molecular docking converting PDBQT format using AutoDock Tools scripts.

title: Prepare receptor PDB files for molecular docking — prepare_receptor
code: prepare_receptor(   pdb_files,   out_dir = "./",   python_path = NULL,   prepare_script = NULL,   add_opts = "-A hydrogens -e True" )

title: Prepare receptor PDB files for molecular docking — prepare_receptor
text: pdb_files Character vector paths PDB files out_dir Character, output directory prepared files, default "./" python_path Character, path Python executable, default "python" prepare_script Character, path prepare_receptor4.py script add_opts Character, additional options pass prepare_receptor4.py, default "-hydrogens -e True"

title: Prepare receptor PDB files for molecular docking — prepare_receptor
text: Character vector paths successfully prepared PDBQT files

title: Prepare receptor PDB files for molecular docking — prepare_receptor
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ pdbqt_files <- prepare_receptor(pdb_files,                                 out_dir = "prepared",                                 prepare_script = "path/to/prepare_receptor4.py") } # }

what: Run molecular docking with AutoDock Vina — run_vina
title: Run molecular docking with AutoDock Vina — run_vina
text: function runs molecular docking using AutoDock Vina.

title: Run molecular docking with AutoDock Vina — run_vina
code: run_vina(   receptor = NULL,   ligand = NULL,   center = NULL,   size = NULL,   config_paths = NULL,   exhaustiveness = 8,   out = "docked",   logs = "logs",   vina_path = NULL,   seed = 12345,   cpu = NULL )

title: Run molecular docking with AutoDock Vina — run_vina
text: receptor Path receptor PDBQT file (direct mode) ligand Path ligand PDBQT file (direct mode) center Numeric vector length 3 box center (x,y,z) (direct mode) size Numeric vector length 3 box size (x,y,z) (direct mode) config_paths Character vector paths config files directories containing config files exhaustiveness Integer, search intensity, default 8 (direct mode) Character, output directory docked files, default "docked" logs Character, output directory log files, default "logs" vina_path Character, path vina executable, default NULL seed Integer, random seed reproducibility, default 12345 cpu Integer, number CPU cores use parallel computation, default NULL (auto-detect)

title: Run molecular docking with AutoDock Vina — run_vina
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Run molecular docking using AutoDock Vina run_vina(   config_paths = "configs",   out = "docked",   logs = "logs" ) } # }

what: Generate qvina or qvina-w config files for docking — write_configs
title: Generate qvina or qvina-w config files for docking — write_configs
text: Generate qvina qvina-w config files docking

title: Generate qvina or qvina-w config files for docking — write_configs
code: write_configs(   receptor_paths,   ligand_paths,   box_df,   out_dir = "configs",   exhaustiveness = 8 )

title: Generate qvina or qvina-w config files for docking — write_configs
text: receptor_paths Character vector, full paths receptor PDBQT files ligand_paths Character vector, full paths ligand PDBQT files box_df Data.frame generated calculate_box(), must contain columns: file (basename without path), center_x/center_y/center_z, size_x/size_y/size_z out_dir Output directory configuration files exhaustiveness Integer, search intensity, default 8

title: Generate qvina or qvina-w config files for docking — write_configs
code: All written configuration file paths (invisible return)

title: Generate qvina or qvina-w config files for docking — write_configs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create configuration files for docking config_files <- write_configs(   receptor_paths = receptor_pdbqt,   ligand_paths = ligand_pdbqt,   box_df = box_params,   out_dir = "configs" ) } # }
